appearances.title: House Democrats Hold Meeting on Fifth Anniversary of Jan. 6 Attack, Part 6 : CSPAN2 : January 7, 2026 3:31am-4:39am EST
appearances.snippet: duncan, georgia was targeted by president trump and giuliani and scott perry and jim jordan and theirgang to try toover turn our election results, using many of the same tactics. i don't think we had to deal with the find more votes part, but certainly we had to deal with a lot of lies and disinformation about the election results in pennsylvania, as well as a campaign to deliver fake electors. and i agree with you, we'd be in a much different place if folks like yourself, republicans at the time, had not stood up and we had al schmidt was the republican election commission in pennsylvania who endured that pressure because he wouldn't undermine the vote total there. we had testimony from jack smith just a couple of weeks ago, the pressure campaign on folks who signed up to be trump electors was intense, and several of them refused to participate because they looked at what was happening and said this isn't legal, and instead of that giving pause to the president and his allies, they just got rid of those electors and found some substitutes who were willing to do their bidding. we talk

appearances.title: Laura Coates Live : CNNW : January 13, 2026 8:00pm-9:00pm PST
appearances.snippet: are pointing out comer's hypocrisy as two of the congressmen standing behind him, andy biggs and scott perry. well, both defied congressional subpoenas themselves from the house january 6th committee in 2022. remember that? joining me now, cnn legal analyst and former federal prosecutor eliot williams. okay, we have a game of legal chicken going on right now. the clintons saying they don't have to follow because it's an invalid subpoena. it doesn't have a legislative purpose. and they are seeking testimony not connected to a federal investigation. is that enough? >> it technically, by the letter of the law, it's enough for them to get out of it. but we'll see what happens in the courts now that no valid legislative purpose language is very important in congressional oversight. i dealt with it when i worked on the hill and at the justice department. congress can engage in oversight of pretty much anything it wants of the federal government or of industry or whatever else. if they have what is called a valid legislative purpose. now, that doesn't have to be just for passing a law. it just has

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 12, 2026 6:30pm-8:16pm EST
appearances.snippet: . >> gentleman from scott perry, wisconsin. >> for what purpose does the gentleman from wisconsin seek recognition? >> i'd like permission to speak for one minute to revise and extend my remarks. >> without objection, the gentleman is recognized for one minute. >> like many americans, i caught a little of the tv over the weekend, which was dominated by the tragic events in minneapolis. however, there's one thing that i felt had to be commented on because i think there's a lot of confusion as to who we should be removing in this country. right now in america, we have no shortage of people who are here from other countries. we are at the all time high, even greater than the 1890s or 20 tens in the number of people in this country who were not born here. over 15%. we are naturalizing about 850,000 people a year. nevertheless, there are congressmen who keep getting confused and think the only people that should be removed from this country. after joe biden left, about 10 million people in the country illegally are people who committed serious crimes. that is ridiculous. we of of the 10 mil

appearances.title: Morning Joe : MSNOW : January 16, 2026 3:00am-7:00am PST
appearances.snippet: where all his vulnerable people are in scranton, in the lehigh valley, in harrisburg, you've got scott perrylected with 50% of the vote. they are right on the edge. they're the first people that will lose. so if you're watching on election night and i'll be watching it this november, on election night, the first returns, they'll come in. will these people all lose? because it will be the first ones in the line of 30 that are going to lose. the people are the most vulnerable, are the ones oftentimes who are in their sophomore years. they've got two years behind them, not enough time to develop any connection with the voter. they're going to be vulnerable. and i look at josh shapiro, who's going to be at the top of the ticket in pennsylvania running against it looks like a real right winger, a real he's been lucky again. it looks like he's got another crazy to go against him. he will be a strong leader. he's a conscientious first person. he seems like a moderate political person, not a left, right or whatever. he just seems like a guy that's doing the job. josh shapiro is going to bring in the

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 13, 2026 4:31pm-9:30pm EST
appearances.snippet: this is what i want to open up for conversation to my good friend from pennsylvania, scott perry, a greatamerican, somebody i'm proud to serve with here in this congress, proud to serve in the houseedom caucus. and i'd like to yield some time in colloquy with my friend from pennsylvania about how he views whose side are we on? that's what i want to know. whose side are we on? are we on thee of american citizens? americans, including some immigrants and immigrant families like beautiful jocelyn nungaray? or are we their side? or officer mendoza? or are we on the side of violent criminals that ice is trying to remove from our streets? because it sure seems like my colleagues on the other side of the aisle are on their side. they're on the bad guy's side. they're really are white hats and black hats. and you have to choose. they're on the bad guy's side. not standing with ice, not standing with law enforcement, not standing up to defend the law enforcement, puttingir lives on the line to keep these guys off our streets so that these americans aren't killed. and i just wonder if my friend fro
